summary: This document outlines a request from the FBI Miami office to the FBI New York office for travel concurrence to conduct witness interviews and serve target letters related to an ongoing investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The investigation focuses on allegations involving underage females recruited for sexual activities with Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the central figure in an FBI investigation involving allegations of child prostitution and sexual activities with underage females.

persons.name: E. Nesbitt Kuyrkendall
persons.context: SA E. Nesbitt Kuyrkendall is mentioned as having a telephone conversation regarding the investigation.

persons.name: Johanna Esposito
persons.context: SA Johanna Esposito is mentioned in connection with a telephone conversation regarding the investigation.

connections.description: Both agents are involved in the same investigation and communicated regarding the case.

events.title: Investigation Opened
events.description: The FBI opened an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein involving allegations of recruiting underage females for sexual activities.

events.title: Travel for Witness Interviews
events.description: FBI Miami requests travel concurrence from FBI New York to conduct witness interviews related to the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The investigation involves allegations of child prostitution and sexual activities with underage females.
Underage females were reportedly paid between $200.00 and $1,000.00 for engaging in sexual activities with Epstein.
The FBI Miami office is coordinating with the FBI New York office for further investigative actions.
